verse: ·A message from [The word of] the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] came to me, saying,

This is what the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: “I ·have a very strong love [am jealous/zealous/passionate] for ·Jerusalem [Zion; 2:7]. My strong love [jealousy; zeal; passion] for her ·is like a fire burning in me [or will mean wrath for her enemies].”

This is what the Lord says: “I will return to Jerusalem and ·live in [dwell in the midst of] it. Then it will be called the City of ·Truth [or Faithfulness], and the mountain of the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] will be called the Holy Mountain [Zion, the location of the Temple].”

This is what the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: “Old men and old women will again sit along Jerusalem’s streets, each carrying a cane because of age [long life due to peace and security].
And the streets will be filled with boys and girls playing.”

This is what the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: “·Those who are left alive then [The remnant] may think it is too ·difficult [marvelous] to happen, but ·it is not [is it…?] too ·difficult [marvelous] for me,” says the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts].
This is what the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: “[Look; Behold] I will save my people from countries in the east and west.
I will bring them back, and they will live in Jerusalem. They will be my people, and I will be their ·loyal [faithful; true] and ·good [righteous] God.”

This is what the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: “·Work hard [Let your hands be strong], you who are hearing these words today. The prophets spoke these words when the foundation was laid for the house of the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], for the building of the Temple.
Before that time there was no money to hire people or animals. People could not ·safely [peacefully] come and go because of the enemies; I had turned everyone against his neighbor.
But I will not do to ·these people who are left [this remnant of the people] what I did in the past,” says the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts].

“They will plant their seeds in peace, their grapevines will have fruit, the ground will give good crops, and the sky will send ·rain [dew]. I will give ·all this [this as an inheritance/possession] to the ·people who are left alive [remnant of this people].

Judah and Israel, your names have been ·used as curses in [or viewed as accursed by] other nations. But I will save you, and you will become a blessing. So don’t be afraid; ·work hard [let your hands be strong].”

This is what the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: “When your ·ancestors [fathers] made me angry, I planned to ·punish [bring disaster on] you. I did not ·change my mind [relent],” says the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts].
“But ·now [in these days] I am planning to do good to Jerusalem and Judah. So don’t be afraid.

These are the things you should do: Tell each other the truth. In ·the courts [your gates; court was held at the city gate] judge with truth and ·complete fairness [sound justice; judgments of peace].
Do not ·make plans to hurt [plan/plot evil in your hearts against] your neighbors, and don’t love false ·promises [oaths]. I hate all these things,” says the Lord.
·A message from [The word of the] Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] came to me again.

This is what the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: “The ·special days when you fast in [fasts of] the fourth, fifth, seventh, and tenth months will become good, joyful, happy feasts ·in [for the house of] Judah. ·But you must [So; Therefore] love truth and peace.”
This is what the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: “·Many people from [Inhabitants of] many cities will still come to Jerusalem.

·People [The inhabitants] from one city will go and say to those from another city, ‘·We are going [Let us go] to ·pray to [entreat] the Lord and to ·ask for help from [or worship; seek] the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts]. ·Come and go with us [I, even I (am going)].’
Many people and powerful nations will come to worship the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] in Jerusalem and to ·pray for help from [or worship; seek] the Lord.”

This is what the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: “At that time, ten men from ·different countries [all languages of the nations] will come and take hold of a ·Judean [Jew] by his coat. They will say to him, ‘Let us go with you, because we have heard that God is with you.’”
